intro: Begonia chiriquina, commonly known as the Chiriquí begonia, is a tropical plant native to Central America. It is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and vibrant, showy flowers that range in color from pink to red. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, often reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters. It prefers moist, well-drained soil and partial shade, making it suitable for shaded garden beds or indoor cultivation. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for horticultural enthusiasts.
